content:
Welcome. After thinking about it for way too long, I’ve finally decided to start writing publicly about things I find interesting.
Why Start a Blog? #I’ve always found that writing helps me think more clearly. Whether I’m learning something new, building a project, or just trying to work through an idea, putting words on a page forces me to organize my thoughts.
This isn’t a professional blog or a carefully curated portfolio. It’s just me writing about whatever I feel like - homelabs, cooking experiments, music, random tech things I’m learning.
What to Expect #Probably a lot of posts about:
Homelab stuff - K8s, self-hosting, infrastructure tinkering Food - recipes I’m trying, restaurants I like Tech - things I’m learning or building Random thoughts - whatever else is on my mind No schedule. Just words on the internet.

title: Hello, World

content:
Hey, I’m Brandon.
What I’m Into #Homelabbing is probably my biggest time sink right now. I tore down my old K3s cluster and I’m planning to rebuild it with Talos. The cycle of building, breaking, and rebuilding is half the fun.
Cooking is how I decompress. I’m not a chef by any stretch, but I enjoy the process - experimenting with recipes, failing spectacularly, and occasionally making something worth eating. Currently on a quest to make the perfect breakfast tacos. I’ve also gotten into baking bread, which is mostly an excuse to eat warm bread with too much butter.
Cars and motorcycles - I’ve owned around 20 cars over the years. I have a thing for DSMs (90s Eclipse, Talon) and have owned several, though I’ve never managed to get one running right. The eternal project car. On two wheels, I have a 2017 Yamaha XSR900 that I take out whenever the weather cooperates.
Travel when I can. I like seeing new places, eating food I can’t pronounce, and getting lost in cities I don’t know.
Gaming casually these days. I raided in WoW from 2007-2014, but now it’s mostly Dyson Sphere Program, Overwatch, and Baldur’s Gate 3 when I have time.
The Day Job #I work in tech - specifically in the product/platform space. I’ve spent years in SRE, DevOps, and now product management. It pays the bills and I genuinely enjoy it, but it’s not my whole personality. You can check out my CV if you’re curious about the professional stuff.
This Site #This is where I write about whatever’s on my mind. Tech stuff, homelab projects, things I’m learning, random thoughts. No schedule, no monetization.
Built with Hugo and the Congo theme.
